In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width || length(result) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end
```

Here is an example:

```julia
s = "This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped because it is too long for the text width of 10 characters."
println(wrap_string(s, 15))
```

In this case, each word in the string is added to the result string on a new line if adding the next word would exceed the maximum allowed `text_width`, or it adds a space after each word otherwise. The final result is printed out.
